Summary: Share state across parent and child components using `IParameter<T>`; changes propagate and re-render referencing components.
Remarks: Declare a parameter in a parent with `[Param] IParameter<T> _param;`. Children access the same parameter using `[Param]` and read/write via `_param.Value` and `_param.Set(...)`. When a parameter value changes, MauiReactor invalidates and re-renders components that reference it (from the defining parent down the subtree). Use `Set(Action<T> setAction, bool invalidateComponent = true)` to control invalidation (set `invalidateComponent: false` to update referenced properties without full invalidation inside the callback). Parameters can be accessed from any ancestor (not just direct parent), enabling shared state and coordination across component trees.
